.ansi-magenta-bg { background-color: #D160C4; }
.ansi-magenta-intense-fg { color: #A03196; }
.ansi-magenta-intense-bg { background-color: #A03196; }
.ansi-cyan-fg { color: #60C6C8; }
.ansi-cyan-bg { background-color: #60C6C8; }
.ansi-cyan-intense-fg { color: #258F8F; }
.ansi-cyan-intense-bg { background-color: #258F8F; }
.ansi-white-fg { color: #C5C1B4; }
.ansi-white-bg { background-color: #C5C1B4; }
.ansi-white-intense-fg { color: #A1A6B2; }
.ansi-white-intense-bg { background-color: #A1A6B2; }

.ansi-bold { font-weight: bold; }
</style>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The following details how the <a href="http://pandas.pydata.org/">pandas</a> library can be used to manipulate data.</p>
<p>First, we import both the pandas and <a href="http://www.numpy.org/">numpy</a> libraries:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [1]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">pandas</span> <span class="kn">as</span> <span class="nn">pd</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">numpy</span> <span class="kn">as</span> <span class="nn">np</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Note the standard abbreviation of pandas to <code>pd</code> and numpy to <code>np</code></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 style="text-align: center">Series</h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 style="text-align: center">Creating a Series</h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Series are one-dimensional, with axis labels. They can be created using <code>pd.Series(data, index)</code>.</p>
<p>The <code>index</code> contains the axis labels for the data. If this argument is excluded, then a default of 0, 1, 2, etc. is used.</p>
<p>We can use a list as input:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [2]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">s</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Series</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">7</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">9</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">index</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'a'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'b'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'c'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'d'</span><span class="p">])</span>

<span class="n">s</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[2]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>a    12
b    -4
c     7
d     9
dtype: int64</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>It has values:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [3]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">s</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">values</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[3]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>array([12, -4,  7,  9])</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>It has index:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [4]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">s</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">index</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[4]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>Index([u'a', u'b', u'c', u'd'], dtype='object')</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><em>Note: the index is immutable - it cannot be subequently changed</em></p>
<p>We can also convert NumPy and other Series objects into Series. Note that changes to the original object will change the Series object that is based on it.</p>
<p>If we use a dictionary as an input, then the provided index will attempt to match up with the keys of the dictionary:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [5]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">dict_series</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Series</span><span class="p">({</span><span class="s1">'a'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'b'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'c'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">},</span> <span class="n">index</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'b'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'a'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'c'</span><span class="p">])</span>

<span class="n">dict_series</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[5]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>b    2
a    1
c    3
dtype: int64</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 style="text-align: center">Selecting Values</h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We can treat the Series like a Python list, by selecting by numerical index. For example, to select the first and second values:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [6]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">s</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">]</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[6]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>a    12
b    -4
dtype: int64</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Or the assigned values can be used. For example, to find the value associated with b:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [7]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">s</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'b'</span><span class="p">]</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[7]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>-4</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Or to select multiple values:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [8]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">s</span><span class="p">[[</span><span class="s1">'b'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'c'</span><span class="p">]]</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[8]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>b   -4
c    7
dtype: int64</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Values can also be selected using conditionals:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [9]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">s</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">s</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">]</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[9]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>b   -4
dtype: int64</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 style="text-align: center">Creating/Updating Data</h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We can assign a new value to a new index as follows:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [10]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">s</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'e'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">3</span>
<span class="n">s</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[10]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>a    12
b    -4
c     7
d     9
e     3
dtype: int64</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 style="text-align: center">Feature Engineering</h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Addition, Subtraction and Multiplication between Series occurs elementwise:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [11]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">s</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Series</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">7</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">9</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">index</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'a'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'b'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'c'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'d'</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">s2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Series</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">6</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">index</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'a'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'b'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'c'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'d'</span><span class="p">])</span>

<span class="n">s</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">s2</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[11]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>a    36
b   -16
c    35
d    54
dtype: int64</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Where there is not a matching entry in <code>s2</code>, an <code>NaN</code> will be inserted.</p>
<p>Applying a method or operator also occurs elementwise:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [12]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">s</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="mi">2</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[12]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>a    6.0
b   -2.0
c    3.5
d    4.5
dtype: float64</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Note that the original value of <code>s</code> remains unchanged</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 style="text-align: center">Sorting a Series</h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>To sort a Series by index:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [13]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">s</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sort_index</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[13]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>a    12
b    -4
c     7
d     9
dtype: int64</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>To sort by value instead:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [14]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">s</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sort_values</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[14]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>b    -4
c     7
d     9
a    12
dtype: int64</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 style="text-align: center">Data Frames</h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 style="text-align: center">Creating a DataFrame</h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The DataFrame extends the Series to multiple dimensions. It does this by operating as a dictionary, where the keys are column names and the values are different Series. As with Series there is a row index, which acts as a primary key.</p>
<p>DataFrames can be created using a dictionary object. Below example from Nelli (2015):</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [15]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'color'</span> <span class="p">:</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'blue'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'green'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'yellow'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'red'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'white'</span><span class="p">],</span>
        <span class="s1">'object'</span> <span class="p">:</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'ball'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'pen'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'pencil'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'paper'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'mug'</span><span class="p">],</span>
        <span class="s1">'price'</span> <span class="p">:</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mf">1.2</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">1.0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">0.6</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">0.9</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">1.7</span><span class="p">]}</span>

<span class="n">frame</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DataFrame</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">frame</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[15]:</div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
<thead>
<tr style="text-align: right;">
<th></th>
<th>color</th>
<th>object</th>
<th>price</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<th>0</th>
<td>blue</td>
<td>ball</td>
<td>1.2</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>1</th>
<td>green</td>
<td>pen</td>
<td>1.0</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>2</th>
<td>yellow</td>
<td>pencil</td>
<td>0.6</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>3</th>
<td>red</td>
<td>paper</td>
<td>0.9</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>4</th>
<td>white</td>
<td>mug</td>
<td>1.7</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Note that the syntax is also similar to JSON, where the names are the column names and the values are the lists.</p>
<p>The argument <code>columns = ['object', 'price']</code> can be used to narrow the columns selected for the DataFrame.</p>
<p>As with Series, the default row index values (0,1,2,...) can be overwritten using argument <code>index = ['one', 'two', ...]</code></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Row index values can also be applied to the inputted data, using nested dictionaries:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [16]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">data2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'color'</span> <span class="p">:</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'one'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'blue'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'two'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'green'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'three'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'yellow'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'four'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'red'</span><span class="p">,</span> 
                    <span class="s1">'five'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'white'</span><span class="p">},</span>
        <span class="s1">'object'</span> <span class="p">:</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'one'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'ball'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'two'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'pen'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'three'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'pencil'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'four'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'paper'</span><span class="p">},</span>
        <span class="s1">'price'</span> <span class="p">:</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'one'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mf">1.2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'two'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mf">1.0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'three'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mf">0.6</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'four'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mf">0.9</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'five'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mf">1.7</span><span class="p">}}</span>

<span class="n">frameb</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DataFrame</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data2</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">frameb</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[16]:</div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
<thead>
<tr style="text-align: right;">
<th></th>
<th>color</th>
<th>object</th>
<th>price</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<th>five</th>
<td>white</td>
<td>NaN</td>
<td>1.7</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>four</th>
<td>red</td>
<td>paper</td>
<td>0.9</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>one</th>
<td>blue</td>
<td>ball</td>
<td>1.2</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>three</th>
<td>yellow</td>
<td>pencil</td>
<td>0.6</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>two</th>
<td>green</td>
<td>pen</td>
<td>1.0</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong><em>Note</em></strong>: <em>if a value is missing, e.g. the object for five, then a <code>NaN</code> is assigned</em></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Another way to see a DataFrame is as the combination of a NumPy matrix, a row index and a column index, as seen below:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [17]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#A NumPy matrix:</span>

<span class="n">matrix</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">matrix</span><span class="p">([[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">],[</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">6</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">7</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">8</span><span class="p">],[</span><span class="mi">9</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">11</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">]])</span>

<span class="c1">#A row index:</span>

<span class="n">row_index</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'one'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'two'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'three'</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="c1">#A column index:</span>

<span class="n">column_index</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'column1'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'column2'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'column3'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'column4'</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="c1">#DataFrame resulting:</span>

<span class="n">frame2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DataFrame</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">matrix</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">index</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">row_index</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">column_index</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">frame2</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[17]:</div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
<thead>
<tr style="text-align: right;">
<th></th>
<th>column1</th>
<th>column2</th>
<th>column3</th>
<th>column4</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<th>one</th>
<td>1</td>
<td>2</td>
<td>3</td>
<td>4</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>two</th>
<td>5</td>
<td>6</td>
<td>7</td>
<td>8</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>three</th>
<td>9</td>
<td>10</td>
<td>11</td>
<td>12</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>As with Series, we can find the index using <code>frame.index</code>, and the values using <code>frame.values</code>. To find the column labels, we use <code>frame.columns</code></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 style="text-align: center">Selecting Values</h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>As a DataFrame is essentially a dictionary, we can output specific columns as Series as follows:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [18]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">frame</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'price'</span><span class="p">]</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[18]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>0    1.2
1    1.0
2    0.6
3    0.9
4    1.7
Name: price, dtype: float64</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Unlike with Python dictionaries, we can achieve the same result through <code>frame.price</code>, as price is an attribute of the DataFrame object.</p>
<p>We can create a new DataFrame, which is a subset of the original, as we would with Python lists:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [19]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">frame</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">]</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[19]:</div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
<thead>
<tr style="text-align: right;">
<th></th>
<th>color</th>
<th>object</th>
<th>price</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<th>0</th>
<td>blue</td>
<td>ball</td>
<td>1.2</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>1</th>
<td>green</td>
<td>pen</td>
<td>1.0</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>2</th>
<td>yellow</td>
<td>pencil</td>
<td>0.6</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>A specific value can be selected from the DataFrame by first selecting a specific Series, <code>frame['price']</code>, and then selecting a specific value within the series <code>frame['price'][2]</code>:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [20]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">frame</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'price'</span><span class="p">][</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">]</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[20]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>0.59999999999999998</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Note that, if we were to select a range of values instead, e.g. [0:3], then a Series will be returned containing the values.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Specific rows can also be selected through use of conditionals:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [21]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">frame</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">frame</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'price'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">></span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[21]:</div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
<thead>
<tr style="text-align: right;">
<th></th>
<th>color</th>
<th>object</th>
<th>price</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<th>0</th>
<td>blue</td>
<td>ball</td>
<td>1.2</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>4</th>
<td>white</td>
<td>mug</td>
<td>1.7</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We can output specific cells (or ranges of cells) using <code>.ix(row,column)</code>. If we want all of the rows, then row = :. Unlike <code>.loc</code>, we can use the row and/or column labels, or we can use their index values:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<ul>
<li>Selecting multiple values in one row, or multiple values in one column returns a Series:</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [22]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">frame2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ix</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[22]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>column1    5
column2    6
column3    7
column4    8
Name: two, dtype: int64</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<ul>
<li>One value can be selected through specifying specific coordinates:</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [23]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">frame2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ix</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'one'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'column4'</span><span class="p">]</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[23]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>4</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<ul>
<li>Selecting values from multiple rows and columns returns a DataFrame:</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [24]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">frame2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ix</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">]</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[24]:</div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
<thead>
<tr style="text-align: right;">
<th></th>
<th>column1</th>
<th>column2</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<th>one</th>
<td>1</td>
<td>2</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>two</th>
<td>5</td>
<td>6</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<ul>
<li>Selecting all rows, one column:</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [25]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">frame2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ix</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[25]:</div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
<thead>
<tr style="text-align: right;">
<th></th>
<th>column1</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<th>one</th>
<td>1</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>two</th>
<td>5</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>three</th>
<td>9</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Note: we have tricked it into returning a DataFrame by giving a range of indices, <code>0:1</code>, for the column argument</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 style="text-align: center">Creating/Updating Data</h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Just as with Python dictionaries and series, a new column can be added/updated as follows:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [26]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">frame</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'new'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="n">frame</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[26]:</div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
<thead>
<tr style="text-align: right;">
<th></th>
<th>color</th>
<th>object</th>
<th>price</th>
<th>new</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<th>0</th>
<td>blue</td>
<td>ball</td>
<td>1.2</td>
<td>1</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>1</th>
<td>green</td>
<td>pen</td>
<td>1.0</td>
<td>2</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>2</th>
<td>yellow</td>
<td>pencil</td>
<td>0.6</td>
<td>3</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>3</th>
<td>red</td>
<td>paper</td>
<td>0.9</td>
<td>4</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>4</th>
<td>white</td>
<td>mug</td>
<td>1.7</td>
<td>5</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The number of values in the list must match the number of rows. We can also input a Series instead of a list.</p>
<p>Using <code>.ix</code>, we can add a row:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [27]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">frame</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ix</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'orange'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'book'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mf">2.1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">6</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="n">frame</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[27]:</div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
<thead>
<tr style="text-align: right;">
<th></th>
<th>color</th>
<th>object</th>
<th>price</th>
<th>new</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<th>0</th>
<td>blue</td>
<td>ball</td>
<td>1.2</td>
<td>1</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>1</th>
<td>green</td>
<td>pen</td>
<td>1.0</td>
<td>2</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>2</th>
<td>yellow</td>
<td>pencil</td>
<td>0.6</td>
<td>3</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>3</th>
<td>red</td>
<td>paper</td>
<td>0.9</td>
<td>4</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>4</th>
<td>white</td>
<td>mug</td>
<td>1.7</td>
<td>5</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>5</th>
<td>orange</td>
<td>book</td>
<td>2.1</td>
<td>6</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The above works similarly to <code>.append()</code>. <code>.append()</code> creates a new DataFrame with a new row, whilst <code>.ix</code> amends the existing DataFrame.</p>
<p>We can also use <code>.ix</code> to add columns: <code>frame.ix[:,'New Column Name']</code></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 style="text-align: center">Deleting Data</h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><code>drop('row label')</code> can be used to delete rows:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [28]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">frame</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">frame</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">drop</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">frame</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[28]:</div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
<thead>
<tr style="text-align: right;">
<th></th>
<th>color</th>
<th>object</th>
<th>price</th>
<th>new</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<th>0</th>
<td>blue</td>
<td>ball</td>
<td>1.2</td>
<td>1</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>1</th>
<td>green</td>
<td>pen</td>
<td>1.0</td>
<td>2</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>2</th>
<td>yellow</td>
<td>pencil</td>
<td>0.6</td>
<td>3</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>3</th>
<td>red</td>
<td>paper</td>
<td>0.9</td>
<td>4</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>4</th>
<td>white</td>
<td>mug</td>
<td>1.7</td>
<td>5</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><code>drop('column label', axis = 1)</code> can be used to remove columns:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [29]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">frame</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">frame</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">drop</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'new'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">axis</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">frame</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[29]:</div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
<thead>
<tr style="text-align: right;">
<th></th>
<th>color</th>
<th>object</th>
<th>price</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<th>0</th>
<td>blue</td>
<td>ball</td>
<td>1.2</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>1</th>
<td>green</td>
<td>pen</td>
<td>1.0</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>2</th>
<td>yellow</td>
<td>pencil</td>
<td>0.6</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>3</th>
<td>red</td>
<td>paper</td>
<td>0.9</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>4</th>
<td>white</td>
<td>mug</td>
<td>1.7</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We can also delete multiple rows/columns using arrays:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [30]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">frame</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">drop</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s1">'color'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'price'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">axis</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[30]:</div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
<thead>
<tr style="text-align: right;">
<th></th>
<th>object</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<th>0</th>
<td>ball</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>1</th>
<td>pen</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>2</th>
<td>pencil</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>3</th>
<td>paper</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>4</th>
<td>mug</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><em>Note: drop creates a new DataFrame with the rows/columns removed. To change the original, we need to reassign what frame refers to.</em></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We can also delete a column using <code>del</code>:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [31]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">frame</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'new'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="k">del</span> <span class="n">frame</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'new'</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="n">frame</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[31]:</div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
<thead>
<tr style="text-align: right;">
<th></th>
<th>color</th>
<th>object</th>
<th>price</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<th>0</th>
<td>blue</td>
<td>ball</td>
<td>1.2</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>1</th>
<td>green</td>
<td>pen</td>
<td>1.0</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>2</th>
<td>yellow</td>
<td>pencil</td>
<td>0.6</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>3</th>
<td>red</td>
<td>paper</td>
<td>0.9</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>4</th>
<td>white</td>
<td>mug</td>
<td>1.7</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 style="text-align: center">Transposing a DataFrame</h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [32]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">frame</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">T</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[32]:</div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
<thead>
<tr style="text-align: right;">
<th></th>
<th>0</th>
<th>1</th>
<th>2</th>
<th>3</th>
<th>4</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<th>color</th>
<td>blue</td>
<td>green</td>
<td>yellow</td>
<td>red</td>
<td>white</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>object</th>
<td>ball</td>
<td>pen</td>
<td>pencil</td>
<td>paper</td>
<td>mug</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>price</th>
<td>1.2</td>
<td>1</td>
<td>0.6</td>
<td>0.9</td>
<td>1.7</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 style="text-align: center">NaN</h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><code>NaN</code> (Not a Number) is used by pandas to indicate a missing value. These values can be detected using <a href="http://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/missing_data.html"><code>notnull()</code> and <code>isnull()</code> functions</a>. <code>NaN</code> can be inserted into data using <code>np.NaN</code></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 style="text-align: center">Testing to see if all of the values are unique</h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>This can be done through accessing the <code>is_unique</code> attribute:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [33]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#Can the row index be used as a primary key?</span>

<span class="k">print</span> <span class="n">frame</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">index</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">is_unique</span>

<span class="c1">#Are all the values in a column unique?</span>

<span class="k">print</span> <span class="n">frame</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'color'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">is_unique</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>True
True
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 style="text-align: center">Applying a function to the elements of a DataFrame</h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>NumPy's universal functions apply elementwise. As pandas are based on NumPy, these functions are still applicable:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [34]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sqrt</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">frame</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'price'</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[34]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>0    1.095445
1    1.000000
2    0.774597
3    0.948683
4    1.303840
Name: price, dtype: float64</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We can also use the <code>.apply()</code> function to apply a given function to each element:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [35]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#Applying lambda to get GBP price</span>

<span class="n">frame</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'GBP Price'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">frame</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'price'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="k">lambda</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'GBP '</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="s1">'0'</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1">#Applying a function to convert to USD price</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">usd_convert</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">price</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">usd_price</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">price</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="mf">1.6</span>
    <span class="n">str_usd_price</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'USD '</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">usd_price</span><span class="p">)</span>   
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">str_usd_price</span> <span class="k">if</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">usd_price</span><span class="p">))</span> <span class="o">>=</span> <span class="mi">4</span> <span class="k">else</span> <span class="n">str_usd_price</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="s1">'0'</span>

<span class="n">frame</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'USD Price'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">frame</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'price'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">usd_convert</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">frame</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[35]:</div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
<thead>
<tr style="text-align: right;">
<th></th>
<th>color</th>
<th>object</th>
<th>price</th>
<th>GBP Price</th>
<th>USD Price</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>

<th>0</th>
<td>blue</td>
<td>ball</td>
<td>1.2</td>
<td>GBP 1.20</td>
<td>USD 1.92</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>1</th>
<td>green</td>
<td>pen</td>
<td>1.0</td>
<td>GBP 1.00</td>
<td>USD 1.60</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>2</th>
<td>yellow</td>
<td>pencil</td>
<td>0.6</td>
<td>GBP 0.60</td>
<td>USD 0.96</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>3</th>
<td>red</td>
<td>paper</td>
<td>0.9</td>
<td>GBP 0.90</td>
<td>USD 1.44</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>4</th>
<td>white</td>
<td>mug</td>
<td>1.7</td>
<td>GBP 1.70</td>
<td>USD 2.72</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 style="text-align: center">Descriptive Statistics</h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [36]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">frame</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">describe</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[36]:</div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
<thead>
<tr style="text-align: right;">
<th></th>
<th>price</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<th>count</th>
<td>5.000000</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>mean</th>
<td>1.080000</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>std</th>
<td>0.408656</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>min</th>
<td>0.600000</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>25%</th>
<td>0.900000</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>50%</th>
<td>1.000000</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>75%</th>
<td>1.200000</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>max</th>
<td>1.700000</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>To get a specific statistic, use function <code>.mean()</code>, <code>.count()</code>, etc. For example:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [37]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">frame</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[37]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>price    1.08
dtype: float64</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>To get the quantiles, use <code>.quantile(decimal)</code>, where <code>decimal</code> is the value of the quantile. For example, to get the 25th quantile:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [38]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">frame</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">quantile</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mf">0.25</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[38]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>price    0.9
dtype: float64</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 style="text-align: center">Sorting a DataFrame</h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Let split the data into two categories:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [39]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">frame</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ix</span><span class="p">[:,</span> <span class="s1">'category'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'B'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'B'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'B'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'A'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'A'</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">frame</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[39]:</div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">

<td>1.2</td>
<td>GBP 1.20</td>
<td>USD 1.92</td>
<td>B</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>1</th>
<td>green</td>
<td>pen</td>
<td>1.0</td>
<td>GBP 1.00</td>
<td>USD 1.60</td>
<td>B</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>2</th>
<td>yellow</td>
<td>pencil</td>
<td>0.6</td>
<td>GBP 0.60</td>
<td>USD 0.96</td>
<td>B</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>3</th>

<td>0.9</td>

</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>To sort just by price:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [40]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">frame</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sort_values</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">by</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'price'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[40]:</div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">

</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>To sort by category and then by price:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [41]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">frame</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sort_values</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">by</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'category'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'price'</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[41]:</div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
